hanzi-su-wiki:
曇

Значения

Быть пасмурным; тускнеть, затуманивать, делать тусклым

Мнемоника

Пасмурность, исчезновение солнца 日 за облаками 雲.

Варианты

昙

tán
dark clouds
темные облака
rtega_mnemonic:
曇曇RS
昙昙		become cloudy, overcast
  • sun 日 behind clouds 雲
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 昙)
Ideographic: The sun 日 hidden behind a cloud 雲
purpleculture_examples:
曇花一現 [ tán huā yī xiàn ]: lit. the night-blooming cactus shows once; flash in the pan (idiom); short-lived
曇花 [ tán huā ]: Dutchman's pipe cactus, aka Queen of the Night cactus (Epiphyllum oxypetalum)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 日 [ rì ] sun; day; daytime
    • 雲 [ yún ] cloud; to say, to speak
heisig_constituent: cloudy weather, sun, day, cloud, rain, weather, rising cloud, two, elbow, wall
heisig_story: We refer to days when the sun is covered by the clouds as cloudy weather.
koohiiStory1: Cloudy weather is when a cloud blocks the sun (up above).
koohiiStory2: In cloudy weather, the sun is still there even if obscured by the clouds...　RTK2:　ドン　曇天　どんてん(cloudy skies).
jp_example_words:
曇り(くもり): cloudiness, cloudy weather, shadow
曇る(くもる): become cloudy, become dim
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The sun is being blocked by a rain cloud, making it cloudy.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You look up at the sky, trying to find the sun, but it's so cloudy that you can't even find where the sun should be.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Remember 雲? It means "cloud" and has the same reading as "cloudy," making them both くも.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If it's cloudy there are clouds, so if you can read one, you can read the other!
Ru_Radicals: 二 (два), 厶 (значок МУ), 日 (день), 雨 (дождь)
Ru_trainchinese: tán: (графема) (букв.) густые облака, тучи; используется в названиях цветов
Kanshudo_mnemonic: when the sun (日) is above the clouds (雲) it's cloudy
humanum_full_description_en:
From " day ", from " cloud ". The original meaning is dense cloud gas. "Shuowen" no, "Shuowen New Attachment": "Tan, clouds and cloth. From the sun and the clouds, you know." For example, Yang Shen of the Ming Dynasty "See the moon after the rain": "The rain gathers the blue mist, the moon blooms and the color is bright." "

"Tan Tan" is often used to describe the appearance of dense clouds. "Jade Chapter": "Tantan, black clouds." As in the Western Jin Dynasty Lu Yun's "Sorrowful Lin Fu": "The clouds are tan and knotted, and the rain is licentious but not scattered." Liang Jiangyan of the Southern Dynasty: "Interview with Taoism": " Overseas, it was gloomy, and Jiang Shangyue was shining."

" Tan " is also a commonly used transliteration word in Buddhism. "Zhengzitong. "Japanese Ministry": "Tan, Sanskrit transliteration, Buddhism means Tan." "Tan Hua" is the abbreviation of "Utan Bowl Flower" in Sanskrit. The blooming time of the night flower is extremely short. "The Lotus Sutra of Wonderful Dharma": "If the Buddha tells the Sariputra, if it is a magical method, the Buddhas are talking about it when they come, such as when the flower is in the pot, the ear will appear." Later generations use the "superior flash in the pan" and "the flash in the pan" to metaphor the transition of things Fleeting. For example, in the Tang Dynasty, Li Jifu's "Preface to the Inscription of Zen Master Dajue in Jingshan Temple, Hangzhou": "In the early days, the master lived in the mountains and forests, rarely received gifts, and was called to Beijing to pass through the prefectures.
humanum_short_description_en: From " day ", from " cloud ". The original meaning is dense clouds. "Tantan" is often used to describe the appearance of dense clouds.
humanum_full_description:
從「日」，從「雲」。本義是密集的雲氣。《說文》無，《說文新附》：「曇，雲布也。从日、雲，會意。」如明代楊慎〈雨後見月〉：「雨氣歛青靄，月華揚彩曇。」

　　「曇曇」疊用多形容烏雲密布之貌。《玉篇》：「曇曇，黑雲皃。」如西晉陸雲〈愁霖賦〉：「雲曇曇而疊結之兮，雨淫淫而未散。」南朝梁江淹〈訪道經〉：「海外陰兮氣曇曇，江上月兮光灼灼。」

　　「曇」也是佛教的常用譯音字。《正字通．日部》：「曇，梵音譯，佛法曰曇。」「曇花」是梵語「優曇鉢花」的簡稱。曇花的開花時間極短。《妙法蓮華經》：「佛告舍利弗，如是妙法，諸佛如來時乃說之，如優曇鉢花時一現耳。」後世便以「優曇一現」、「曇花一現」比喻事物轉瞬即逝。如唐代李吉甫〈杭州徑山寺大覺禪師碑銘序〉：「初，大師宴居山林，人罕接禮，及召赴京邑，途經郡國，譬若優曇一現。」
humanum_short_description: 從「日」，從「雲」。本義是密集的雲氣，「曇曇」疊用多形容烏雲密布之貌。

從「 日 」，從「 雲 」。本義是密集的雲氣。《說文》無，《說文新附》：「曇，雲布也。从日、雲，會意。」如明代楊慎〈雨後見月〉：「雨氣歛青靄，月華揚彩曇。」 「曇曇」疊用多形容烏雲密布之貌。《玉篇》：「曇曇，黑雲皃。」如西晉陸雲〈愁霖賦〉：「雲曇曇而疊結之兮，雨淫淫而未散。」南朝梁江淹〈訪道經〉：「海外陰兮氣曇曇，江上月兮光灼灼。」 「 曇 」也是佛教的常用譯音字。《正字通．日部》：「曇，梵音譯，佛法曰曇。」「曇花」是梵語「優曇鉢花」的簡稱。曇花的開花時間極短。《妙法蓮華經》：「佛告舍利弗，如是妙法，諸佛如來時乃說之，如優曇鉢花時一現耳。」後世便以「優曇一現」、「曇花一現」比喻事物轉瞬即逝。如唐代李吉甫〈杭州徑山寺大覺禪師碑銘序〉：「初，大師宴居山林，人罕接禮，及召赴京邑，途經郡國，譬若優曇一現。」

For example, Yang Shen of the Ming Dynasty "See the moon after the rain": "The rain gathers the blue mist, the moon blooms and the color is bright." " "Tan Tan" is often used to describe the appearance of dense clouds. "Jade Chapter": "Tantan, black clouds." As in the Western Jin Dynasty Lu Yun's "Sorrowful Lin Fu": "The clouds are tan and knotted, and the rain is licentious but not scattered." Liang Jiangyan of the Southern Dynasty: "Interview with Taoism": " Overseas, it was gloomy, and Jiang Shangyue was shining." " Tan" is also a commonly used transliteration word in Buddhism. "Zhengzitong. "Japanese Ministry": "Tan, Sanskrit transliteration, Buddhism means Tan." "Tan Hua" is the abbreviation of "Utan Bowl Flower" in Sanskrit. 曇字的基本解释

曇
tán
见“昙”。

曇字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tán］
［《廣韻》徒含切，平覃，定。］
“昙1”的繁体字。
(1)密布的云气。
(2)引申为阴暗，天阴。
(3)译音用字。参见“曇花”。
(4)昙摩。意为法，佛法。

曇字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　曇； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页500第13
【唐韻】【正韻】徒含切【集韻】徒南切，?音覃。【說文】雲布也。【玉篇】曇曇，黑雲貌。　又【玉篇】西國呼世尊瞿曇。

曇字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
曇字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tán］
["Guangyun" Tu Hanqie, Pingtan, Ding. ]
Traditional characters for "昙1".
(1) Dense clouds.
(2) By extension, it is dark and overcast.
(3) Transliteration. See "Ephemera".
(4) Tempest. It means Dharma, Dharma.

[Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Tu Hanqie [Jiyun] Tu Nanqie,? Yin Tan. [Said the text] Yunbu also. [Jade articles] Tantan, dark cloud appearance.　[Jade articles] The Western Kingdom calls the World Zun Qu Tan.

tán
вм. 昙
Radicals: 日, 雨, 云  (sun, rain, cloud)
Meaning Mnemonic
The sun is being blocked by a rain cloud, making it cloudy.
You look up at the sky, trying to find the sun, but it's so cloudy that you can't even find where the sun should be.
Reading Mnemonic
Remember 雲? It means "cloud" and has the same reading as "cloudy," making them both くも.
If it's cloudy there are clouds, so if you can read one, you can read the other!
